channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Afghan girls school ban would be un-Islamic, Pakistan PM says
item.description: Prime Minister Imran Khan speaks to the BBC's John Simpson about events in neighbouring Afghanistan.

item.title: Aukus: Australia's big gamble on the US over China
item.description: Australia has taken a central role in the Aukus defence pact - there are major benefits and risks too.

item.title: Pew study: Little change in India's religious make-up in 70 years
item.description: The population trebled in 70 years but saw few changes to its religious composition, a study shows.

item.title: Evergrande: Asia stocks mixed as investors weigh China concerns
item.description: The Chinese property giant is facing a debt crisis, triggering fears of contagion in global markets.

item.title: CIA officer 'suffered from Havana syndrome' during India trip
item.description: US media say the officer fell ill while visiting India with CIA Director William Burns this month.

item.title: Cambodia: The autistic teenager jailed over a Telegram post
item.description: He allegedly insulted Cambodia's government, prompting heavily-armed policemen to arrest him.

item.title: UK defence secretary angered by Afghan data breach
item.description: Ben Wallace apologises to Afghan interpreters, mistakenly copied into an email, as one person is suspended.

item.title: Covid: Melbourne construction sites shut after violent vaccine protest
item.description: Construction sites in the Australian city are shut for two weeks after a demonstration against jabs.

item.title: Guinness World Records: Japanese sisters certified world's oldest twins
item.description: Umeno Sumiyama and Koume Kodama from Japan receive their Guinness World Records awards.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fighting off hunger under the Taliban
item.description: For most Afghans staving off starvation is the biggest challenge since the Taliban returned to power.

item.title: Hong Kong sees patriots inducted into new election committee
item.description: Hong Kong had earlier passed a way designed to keep "unpatriotic" people from positions of power.

item.title: China: Children given daily time limit on Douyin - its version of TikTok
item.description: Douyin users aged under 14 will be limited to 40 minutes a day on the platform.

item.title: Afghanistan: Stay home, female Kabul government workers told
item.description: It is the latest restriction imposed on Afghanistan's women by the country's new Taliban rulers.

item.title: K-pop stars BTS perform at UN General Assembly
item.description: The UN general debate opened with K-pop band BTS, followed by a speech about sustainable development.

item.title: Manny Pacquiao: Boxing star to run for Philippines president
item.description: Manny Pacquiao is a senator in parliament and remains active in the ring after a successful career.

item.title: Charanjit Singh Channi: What Punjab leadership change says about Congress
item.description: The crisis in Punjab sees the party shying from the status quo - is this a sign of things to come?

item.title: Giving birth under the Taliban
item.description: Pregnant women, new mothers and infants are bearing the brunt of a worsening healthcare crisis.

item.title: India Covid-19: Meet the teacher who turned a street into a classroom
item.description: A primary school teacher has found an innovative way to resume classes in India's rural West Bengal state.

item.title: China: What is Evergrande and is it too big to fail?
item.description: The world's most indebted real estate developer is in crisis, spooking global investors.

item.title: My husband and son fought in Afghanistan - it changed all of us
item.description: America's two decades in Afghanistan impacted those who served - and the families waiting at home.

item.title: Turkmenistan: Getting Covid in a land where no cases officially exist
item.description: People in Turkmenistan are struggling to get treatment in a system that denies there are any cases.

item.title: Climate change: The world awaits India's net zero emission deadline
item.description: India has given no clarity on how and when it plans to meet its net zero emission target.

item.title: Afghanistan: The escape of the whirling dancer
item.description: How the only female whirling dancer in Afghanistan made it out of Kabul.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'shattered dreams' of the Ariana cabin crew
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet meets the female crew of Afghanistan's national airline, who are in hiding.
